III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During the week of 8/11/24 or 8/18/24, there was an incident
where a youth was taken to the hospital and returned the next
day. A staff person at the facility was aggressive with the youth
and the youth had bruises on their legs and arms from being
pushed into a room to get away from other youth. On 8/27/24 or
8/28/24, youth had to be restrained due to self-harming. A staff
person slapped the youth on the arm.
Investigation Note: The allegation “During the week of 8/11/24 or 8/18/24, there
was an incident where a youth was taken to the hospital and
returned the next day. A staff person at the facility was aggressive
with the youth and the youth had bruises on their legs and arms
from being pushed into a room to get away from other youth” is
being addressed through SIR #2024SIC0001676.
INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 9/4/24.
Complainant reported Youth A told her she was slapped twice on
the arm by a staff during a restraint on 8/27/24 or 8/28/24, but
Youth A didn’t provide the staff’s name. Complainant reported
Youth A doesn’t want to be at the facility and Youth A feels if she
pushes hard enough, she will be removed from the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/3/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she
doesn’t pay attention to the rules at the facility and doesn’t care
about their rules. Youth A reported she doesn’t feel safe because
“staff like to put hands on [her], push [her] around, and treat [her]
like a slave”. Youth A could not provide specific examples of when
this occurred. Youth A reported she was restrained on 8/27/24 by
Staff 2 and Staff 4 because she tried to kill herself. Youth A
reported Staff 2 and Staff 4 put bruises all over her body. Youth A
could not provide a description of how Staff 2 or Staff 4’s actions
caused there to be bruises on her body, and she could not provide
a description of exactly where she had bruises on her body. At the
time of the interview on 9/3/24, Youth A showed she had one
2

small bruise on her forearm but showed no other bruises. Youth A
reported she was trying to cut her arm with a diamond art pen and
Staff 3 saw her. Youth A reported Staff 3 told Staff 5 and Staff 1
what happened, so all three of them came and took objects from
her so she couldn’t hurt herself. Youth A reported she shoved the
diamond art pen in her bra so no one could take it from her. Youth
A reported she was then put into a restraint by Staff 2 and Staff 4.
She reported they grabbed her arms and put them behind her.
Youth A reported she was leaning against the wall while staff were
holding her arms behind her. Youth A reported she then got her
arms away from staff, slid down the wall, sat down with her back
against the wall and began slamming her head against the wall. At
first, Youth A reported she only remembered Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 4 being present during the restraint. Then Youth A reported
during the restraint, Staff 1 grabbed her arm. Youth A reported no
staff hit her, slapped her or harmed her during the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/3/24 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on 8/27/24,
Staff 3 told Staff 1 Youth A harmed herself with a diamond art
stick by scratching her arm with it. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 3
attempted to get the diamond art stick away from Youth A, but
Youth A wouldn’t give it to them. Staff 1 reported another staff
(can’t remember who) was trying to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 1
reported Youth A calmed down, but then re-escalated and was
kicking the door to the wing trying to get it to open. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 approached Youth A and Youth A immediately
started swinging her fists at Staff 2. Staff 1 reported she and Staff
2 attempted to secure Youth A, but she kept flailing. Staff 1
reported Youth A accused her of slapping her, but Staff 1 reported
Youth A flailing while the restraint was being attempted is what
caused Staff 1’s hand to contact Youth A’s arm. Staff 1 reported
she and Staff 2 were able to restrain Youth A briefly, but then
Youth A dropped to the floor, so they released the hold. Staff 1
reported Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 6 were present.
Staff 2 was interviewed via video conference on 10/7/24. Staff
2 reported he asked Youth A what was going on, but then he saw
she had a pen and was self-harming. Staff 2 reported Youth A put
the pen in her shirt, so other staff attempted to try and get the pen
from her. Staff 2 reported Youth A began kicking the doors in the
hallway to get them to open. Staff 2 reported Youth A tried to hit
Staff 1 once or twice. Staff 2 reported while they were attempting
to restrain Youth A, Youth A accused Staff 1 of slapping her. Staff
2 reported Youth A was kicking and flailing her arms, so if Staff 1’s
hand made contact with Youth A’s body at all, it was because of
3

Youth A’s actions, and wasn’t intentional by Staff 1. Staff 2
reported he did not see any staff slap Youth A during the incident
or restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 10/3/24. Staff
3 reported she, Staff 1 and Staff 5 were present on the unit and
Youth A was using a diamond art kit. Youth A began trying to
swallow the diamond art pieces, which Staff 3 advised her against
doing. Then Youth A threatened to swallow the whole bag of
diamond art pieces, but when asked, Youth A wouldn’t tell staff
why she was upset or trying to harm herself. Staff 3 reported she,
Staff 1 and Staff 5 continued to try and de-escalate Youth A, and
asked Youth A to hand over the supplies, but Youth A refused.
Staff 3 reported after Youth A began harming herself with the
diamond art pen, and hid it from staff, Staff 1 attempted a restraint
to stop Youth A from continuing to harm herself. Staff 3 reported
while Staff 1 was attempting the restraint, Youth A was moving a
lot and flailing her arms. Youth A said Staff 1 slapped her. Staff 3
reported she did not see Staff 1’s hand make contact with Youth
A’s arm. However, Staff 3 reported if any contact between Staff
1’s hand and Youth A’s arm occurred, it was because Youth A
was flailing, and it was not an intentional action by Staff 1. Staff 3
reported she attempted to explain that to Youth A, but Youth A
refused to listen.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 9/26/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she entered the building to
speak to a coworker when she saw the commotion on the unit, so
she entered the unit to assist. Staff 4 reported when she entered
the unit, Youth A was already escalated. Staff 4 reported Staff 1
attempted to tap out of the restraint, so Staff 4 attempted to relieve
her. Staff 4 reported when she stepped in, she couldn’t complete
the hold properly, so she stopped. Staff 4 reported while she was
present, no staff slapped, hit, or were aggressive with Youth A.
Staff 4 reported Youth A did not complain of being injured during
the restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 9/27/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she doesn’t remember a
lot from the incident due to the length of time since it occurred.
Staff 5 reported she remembers Youth A was restrained due to
self-harming with a diamond art pen, but Staff 5 reported she
wasn’t involved in the restraint and doesn’t remember who was.
Staff 5 reported she remembers attempting to verbally de-escalate
Youth A, but it didn’t work. Staff 5 reported she did not see any
staff slap, hit, or harm Youth A during the restraint.
4

Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 9/26/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported she wasn’t present for an
incident with Youth A involving a diamond art pen and hasn’t been
involved in any restraints for Youth A.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage from 8/27/24 was reviewed. However, the video
footage is too dark and too far away since Youth A and staff were
down towards the end of the hallway when the incident occurred.
It is unclear who the participants are or what occurred in the video.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #193190238 for incident dated
8/27/24 states Youth A told Staff 3 she wanted to commit
suicide, so Staff 3 immediately informed Staff 1 and Staff 5
what was said. Youth A walked into the living area and was
cutting her arm with the metal tip of a pen. Staff 2 and Staff
4 stepped onto the unit to assist. Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3
all assisted with getting the pen away from Youth A. Youth
A began kicking the unit door. Staff 2 attempted to use
verbal de-escalation techniques with Youth A, but to no
avail. Youth A kept kicking the door and began threatening
physical harm to staff. Staff 2 attempted to guide Youth A
away from the door, but Youth A began punching Staff 2.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 placed Youth A in a physical restraint for
approximately 45 seconds. Youth A dropped to the floor
and was immediately released. While Youth A was on the
floor, she began to punch Staff 1 and Staff 2, so they put
Youth A in another physical restraint to stop her assaults.
After approximately 2-3 minutes, Staff 4 relieved Staff 1 on
the left side. Youth A was in the restraint for approximately
2 more minutes until she stopped trying to assault staff. A
nurse looked over Youth A and no injuries were noted.
There is no record of Youth A being slapped or hit by any
staff.
• Vista Maria Residential Programs Behavior Management
Policy states personal physical intervention shall not be
imposed as a means of coercion, discipline, convenience,
or retaliation by staff.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews conducted,
Youth A and multiple staff reported no staff slapped or hit Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
